Class StairCase

  • java.lang.Object
    • StairCase

  • public class StairCase
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StairCase() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void HighLow(int n)
      This method creates a staircase high to low of stars.
      static void LowHigh(int n)
      This method goes from low to to high meaning the top row has 5 stars and then it goes down to 1.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      This main method calls the other two methods plugging in their arguments with 5 Between the two methods it prints a line to separate the two

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • StairCase

        public StairCase()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This main method calls the other two methods plugging in their arguments with 5 Between the two methods it prints a line to separate the two

      • HighLow

        public static void HighLow(int n)
        This method creates a staircase high to low of stars. It takes in an integer and uses a nested loop to produce the staircase. the first loop of this is the row and the nested loop is the column
        Parameters:
        integer - n is the number of rows and columns

      • LowHigh

        public static void LowHigh(int n)
        This method goes from low to to high meaning the top row has 5 stars and then it goes down to 1. It is also a nested loop but with the numbers going down from n to 1 rather then from 1 to n.
        Parameters:
        integer - n is the number of rows and columns
